name: Tuxedo
description: Did I mention this drink is dry? Good lord, it's nothing less than arid—your typical dry martini is positively flamboyant next to a cocktail as reserved as the Tuxedo. But don't take this dryness as a sign that it's boring; rather, the sherry brings a touch of its distinctive nuttiness to the drink, which puts a new spring in the gin's step and makes this relative of the classic martini a worthwhile variation.
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces gin (Plymouth works very well in this drink)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass; fill with ice, and stir briskly for 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
